Comment: That phrasing is so suspect. Blocking the street is still peaceful, even if it's breaking the law. That phrase "intended to be" betrays a bias in the person who wrote it.
Author: enjoycarrots

Comment: I was there. Protesters were peaceful and knew full well that they were going to be arrested after multiple warnings by police. There were A TON of police, and two buses to haul away protesters to a local police station in Philly. There was no resisting arrest and the crowd around the protesters were fully supportive and vigilant. There was an initial bike line of police officers which maintained the perimeter, then about 30-40 police in more equipped gear came and made the arrests. I did find it interesting that some of the arresting officers were wearing clothing that obstructed their face/identity.
Author: Rocket_League-Champ

Comment: The intended statement is "The protest was intended to be civilly obedient; instead protestors were civilly disobedient."  It's the word play of:  Peace is the absence of X (violence)   Peace is the presence of Y (order)   Pick one as needed
